<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> Imagine for a moment that you’re on a failing first date. In a last ditch effort your date asks you the standard icebreaker question, “If you could bring one thing to a deserted island, what would it be?” You try to think of something to impress them: a book? A copy of the 2011 comedy <em>Hall Pass</em>? But then you remember the coolest thing you can think of: your <a href="https://coolcabanas.com/products/coolcabana-5_navy-stripes?utm_source=morning-brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=memorial%20day" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CoolCabanas</a>. Your date gasps and through excited tears asks, “You mean the world’s best beach shelter?” They immediately propose. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why we are sending 30 beach cabanas to readers for this month’s giveaway. You can enter to win by referring friends to the Brew with your unique referral link: 1 referral = 1 entry in the raffle. The contest runs for exactly one week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Start sharing to win</a>. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/dc-sues-amazon-antitrust?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Everything Is Expensive Store
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/dc-sues-amazon-antitrust" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the Washington monument skewering Amazon's " a" logo with the curved arrow underneath." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjM1L2FtYXpvbl9za2V3ZXJlZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Do Amazon's marketplace policies make shopping on the internet more expensive?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Washington, DC, Attorney General Karl Racine thinks so, which is why he <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/25/dc-attorney-general-sues-amazon-on-antitrust-grounds-alleges-it-illegally-raises-prices.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> Amazon over antitrust allegations yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Those allegations: </strong>Amazon's restrictive agreements with third-party sellers limit their ability to sell products for less on other e-commerce sites, artificially inflating prices and reducing competition. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Until 2019, the suit says, Amazon flat-out banned sellers on its marketplace from offering their items for cheaper elsewhere.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When lawmakers started snooping around, Amazon threw out that rule...then ended up replacing it with a clone, Racine said. If sellers try to list products on other sites for a lower cost, Amazon will allegedly </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/25/technology/amazon-antitrust-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bury them</a></span><span> on its site.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a statement, Amazon said Racine "has it exactly backwards—sellers set their own prices for the products they offer in our store...and like any store we reserve the right not to highlight offers to customers that are not priced competitively.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it's a big deal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually...if we're being honest...the lawsuit itself <em>isn't </em>a huge deal. It was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/25/business/amazon-dc-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed only in DC</a>, not federal court, and Racine didn't invite other AGs to the party, as is common in these types of cases. So overall, the lawsuit doesn't have a lot of teeth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it's important in many ways, too. It's believed to be the first time that Amazon's been sued by the US government over antitrust allegations. It also strikes at the core of Amazon's retail business: its marketplace, which brings in more than half of the company's total sales.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Amazon now joins Facebook and Google, which have both been hit with antitrust lawsuits. Those cases will be slower moving than you on a Saturday morning, and experts say the tech companies have the advantage due to the current structure of antitrust law.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/vimeo-goes-public-spinning-off-iac?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
IAC Just Keeps Spinning with Vimeo IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/vimeo-goes-public-spinning-off-iac" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simone Biles" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/jpG2iOeexpJM7b3lig/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simone Biles" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/jpG2iOeexpJM7b3lig/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's no Yurchenko double pike, but Vimeo became the 11th company to be spun off from IAC yesterday when it went public on the NYSE. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>IAC, a holding company, is known for prolific dealmaking; previous spin-offs include Match Group, Expedia, and LendingTree.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Vimeo's no longer an "indie version of YouTube" </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CEO Anjali Sud told The Verge that, <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/20/22392228/vimeo-ceo-interview-streaming-software-business-anjali-sud?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under her leadership</a>, it's become "more like a Slack or a Dropbox model, but for video." Vimeo's main business is software as a service, or Saas, that makes it easier for the Average Joe's Gymnasiums of the world to create and distribute video content. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The strategic pivot is <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/iac-completes-vimeo-spinoff-expect-growing-speculation-on-what-it-may-sell-next-51621954783?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paying off</a>. In the first quarter of 2021, Vimeo reported…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$89.4 million in revenue, a 57% annual increase </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$3.3 million in net profit, compared to a $20.3 million loss last year</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Sud told Barron's that Vimeo's growth will slow later this year as face masks come down and in-person happy hours come back, but should pick back up in 2022.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/vertical-farming-startup-bowery-valued-23b-latest-round?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Young MacDonald Has a Farm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/vertical-farming-startup-bowery-valued-23b-latest-round" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photograph of a vertical farm growing lettuce. A worker in a white plastic suit stands between two rows of tall shelves; on each shelf is hundreds of growing lettuce plants. The entire farm is awash with a purple light. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjM3L3ZlcnRpY2FsX2Zhcm1pbmcucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Lianoland" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lianoland Wimons</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Sgverticalfarming1.png" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sgverticalfarming1</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Bowery Farming <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/vertical-farming-company-bowery-raises-300m-valuing-firm-at-23b/600777/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a $300 million fundraising round that included A-list investors like Natalie Portman, José Andrés, and Lewis Hamilton. Justin Timberlake also chipped in.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The startup, now valued at $2.3 billion, grows produce using indoor vertical farming setups. Its 13 varieties of greens are sold in 850 stores, and with its new funds it'll build additional farms and expand into new crops including tomatoes, strawberries, and carrots.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Sci-fi farming is catching on</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Climate change concerns and a renewed focus on the food supply chain have contributed to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-agriculture-indoor-focus/investors-seed-indoor-farms-as-pandemic-disrupts-food-supplies-idUSKBN2AI1KH?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased investor appetite</a> for indoor farming. Last year, global VC investment in indoor farms tripled to almost $1.9 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bowery's deal is the biggest on record for the industry, but competitors have scored plenty of dough in recent months, including BrightFarms ($100 million last October), "Omakase" strawberry grower Oishii ($50 million in March), and AppHarvest, which SPAC'd in February and is now worth $1.5 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The indoor farming sector is growing but is still just a wee seedling. In 2019, California grew nearly 4x more pounds of lettuce than all indoor-grown veggies across the country combined. </p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/new-home-sales-slump-6-april?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/new-home-sales-slump-6-april" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="housing market " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDYvaG91c2luZ19tYXJrZXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the <a href="https://apnews.com/article/home-sales-business-85b60c3e5f2736266d1d7ab460796311?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest US housing data</a>...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sales are <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-downwards-trend_1f4c9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">: </strong>New home sales in April fell almost 6%, more than analysts expected. Every region saw a decline except the West, which was up ~8%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Prices are <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">: </strong>The median price of a new home jumped 11.4% in April to $372,400.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those are connected. The number of homes for sale remains low, and expensive lumber and supply chain shortages are delaying new ones from being built. The backlog of new homes sold in April but awaiting construction rose 16.5%, the most since 2006, Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-25/there-are-some-wild-observations-on-housing-market-twitter-today?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Redfin CEO Glenn Kelman <a href="https://twitter.com/glennkelman/status/1397189637207121929?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rounded up</a> some anecdotes from this "bizarre" housing market yesterday:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>63% of surveyed buyers said they put in a bid without seeing a property in person. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sales are closing an average 1.7% above asking price, despite home prices already rising 24% annually.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lenders have called employers to confirm buyers have permission to WFH after the pandemic. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Best for last: One would-be homebuyer promised to name her first-born after the seller. She didn't get the house. </span></li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Put the "I" in Ikea: </strong>Here's a <a href="https://self-assembly.org/collection/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collection</a> of home accessory and furniture projects to make yourself, ranging from a simple vase to a legit velvet sofa.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nANTITRUST \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/dc-sues-amazon-antitrust?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Everything Is Expensive Store\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/25/dc-sues-amazon-antitrust\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An illustration of the Washington monument skewering Amazon's \"a\" logo with the curved arrow underneath.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjM1L2FtYXpvbl9za2V3ZXJlZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDo Amazon's marketplace policies make shopping on the internet more expensive?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWashington, DC, Attorney General Karl Racine thinks so, which is why he \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/25/dc-attorney-general-sues-amazon-on-antitrust-grounds-alleges-it-illegally-raises-prices.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e Amazon over antitrust allegations yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThose allegations: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon's restrictive agreements with third-party sellers limit their ability to sell products for less on other e-commerce sites, artificially inflating prices and reducing competition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUntil 2019, the suit says, Amazon flat-out banned sellers on its marketplace from offering their items for cheaper elsewhere.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhen lawmakers started snooping around, Amazon threw out that rule...then ended up replacing it with a clone, Racine said. If sellers try to list products on other sites for a lower cost, Amazon will allegedly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/25/technology/amazon-antitrust-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebury them\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on its site.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a statement, Amazon said Racine \"has it exactly backwards—sellers set their own prices for the products they offer in our store...and like any store we reserve the right not to highlight offers to customers that are not priced competitively.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy it's a big deal\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eActually...if we're being honest...the lawsuit itself \u003cem\u003eisn't \u003c/em\u003ea huge deal. It was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/25/business/amazon-dc-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled only in DC\u003c/a\u003e, not federal court, and Racine didn't invite other AGs to the party, as is common in these types of cases. So overall, the lawsuit doesn't have a lot of teeth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it's important in many ways, too. It's believed to be the first time that Amazon's been sued by the US government over antitrust allegations. It also strikes at the core of Amazon's retail business: its marketplace, which brings in more than half of the company's total sales.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon now joins Facebook and Google, which have both been hit with antitrust lawsuits. Those cases will be slower moving than you on a Saturday morning, and experts say the tech companies have the advantage due to the current structure of antitrust law.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's no Yurchenko double pike, but Vimeo became the 11th company to be spun off from IAC yesterday when it went public on the NYSE. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIAC, a holding company, is known for prolific dealmaking; previous spin-offs include Match Group, Expedia, and LendingTree.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eVimeo's no longer an \"indie version of YouTube\" \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCEO Anjali Sud told The Verge that, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/20/22392228/vimeo-ceo-interview-streaming-software-business-anjali-sud?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunder her leadership\u003c/a\u003e, it's become \"more like a Slack or a Dropbox model, but for video.\" Vimeo's main business is software as a service, or Saas, that makes it easier for the Average Joe's Gymnasiums of the world to create and distribute video content. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe strategic pivot is \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/iac-completes-vimeo-spinoff-expect-growing-speculation-on-what-it-may-sell-next-51621954783?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaying off\u003c/a\u003e. In the first quarter of 2021, Vimeo reported…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$89.4 million in revenue, a 57% annual increase \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$3.3 million in net profit, compared to a $20.3 million loss last year\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eSud told Barron's that Vimeo's growth will slow later this year as face masks come down and in-person happy hours come back, but should pick back up in 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Justin Timberlake also chipped in.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe startup, now valued at $2.3 billion, grows produce using indoor vertical farming setups. Its 13 varieties of greens are sold in 850 stores, and with its new funds it'll build additional farms and expand into new crops including tomatoes, strawberries, and carrots.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSci-fi farming is catching on\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClimate change concerns and a renewed focus on the food supply chain have contributed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-agriculture-indoor-focus/investors-seed-indoor-farms-as-pandemic-disrupts-food-supplies-idUSKBN2AI1KH?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased investor appetite\u003c/a\u003e for indoor farming. Last year, global VC investment in indoor farms tripled to almost $1.9 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBowery's deal is the biggest on record for the industry, but competitors have scored plenty of dough in recent months, including BrightFarms ($100 million last October), \"Omakase\" strawberry grower Oishii ($50 million in March), and AppHarvest, which SPAC'd in February and is now worth $1.5 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe indoor farming sector is growing but is still just a wee seedling. #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elatest US housing data\u003c/a\u003e...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSales are \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-downwards-trend_1f4c9.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e: \u003c/strong\u003eNew home sales in April fell almost 6%, more than analysts expected. Every region saw a decline except the West, which was up ~8%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrices are \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e: \u003c/strong\u003eThe median price of a new home jumped 11.4% in April to $372,400.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose are connected. The number of homes for sale remains low, and expensive lumber and supply chain shortages are delaying new ones from being built. The backlog of new homes sold in April but awaiting construction rose 16.5%, the most since 2006, Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-25/there-are-some-wild-observations-on-housing-market-twitter-today?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eRedfin CEO Glenn Kelman \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/glennkelman/status/1397189637207121929?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erounded up\u003c/a\u003e some anecdotes from this \"bizarre\" housing market yesterday:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e63% of surveyed buyers said they put in a bid without seeing a property in person. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSales are closing an average 1.7% above asking price, despite home prices already rising 24% annually.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLenders have called employers to confirm buyers have permission to WFH after the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBest for last: One would-be homebuyer promised to name her first-born after the seller.
